text: we took to the open seas to reach Yemen
this was our only way in after a voyage
of 21 hours we approached the southern
port of Aden the now absent President
Albert robber Hardy stares down over the
harbor what happens here could decide
the future of Yemen well we're now
finally coming ashore we've been told
there were earth strikes just a few
hours before we arrived we've also been
warned not to stay any longer than is
necessary because there's always a risk
of kidnap by al Qaeda in the Arabian
Peninsula
around the port scars of the recent
conflict and locals like Raj are
desperate for help everything we lost
everything no food no water no electric
no situation no life you know no life
here the streets looked like a
battlefield few here venture out if they
can avoid it apart from local fighters
loyal to the president many still in
their teens they say they'll stop the
Houthi rebel advance this group was
manning the door at a local hospital
inside some new arrivals on average
there are thirty a day many shot by
snipers both civilians and fighters some
keeping their guns by the bed in
intensive care after at Muhammad a
sleepy five-year-old doctor say he was
hit by shrapnel inside his home but they
expect him to recover this is in the
morning gunshot in the lift in the right
shoulder going
this is in the Molly orthopedic surgeon
Mohamed Mohsen tells me the hospital
can't cope with the flow of wounded now
we have only very little and not
everything we have sometimes we in the
difficult position are the patients
dying because you don't have the
supplies yes yes well they just don't
have enough beds here for all the
wounded who are being brought in doctors
say they need antibiotics they need
bandages the power is coming and going
it's off at the moment they're using a
generator but that will run out of fuel
in six hours time and there's no more
available to buy back at the port
families keep a vigil hoping against
hope to find a way out among them we
found Abdul from Birmingham stranded by
Yemen's Civil War all you do is he is
like the house shakes a couple of houses
you know gone down and you see that well
someone god I shouldn't be down there
maybe I should move a different kind of
area and because you got family as well
you're just trying to run from one place
to another but where to run in a city
under fire our parting image was ominous
the nightly warfare beginning again or
ligerian BBC news Aidan
